skill.name: testing-patterns
skill.description: Vitest testing patterns and strategies for unit tests, agent tests, and API tests with Supabase mocking
skill.summary: Vitest testing patterns and strategies for unit tests, agent tests, and API tests with Supabase mock...
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown documentation with TypeScript test examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond reading the file. All 31 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown code block syntax (backticks) and JSON metadata fields as security-sensitive patterns.

content.value_statement: Writing tests for new features, agents, and API routes requires consistent patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use Vitest patterns for unit tests, agent tests, and API tests with Supabase mocking.
actual_capabilities: Write unit tests for services and utilities using Vitest
Test AI agents with mocked Supabase clients
Test API routes including authentication and validation
Apply coverage requirements for unit, integration, and E2E tests
Structure tests with beforeEach and mock cleanup
limitations: Does not execute tests or generate test files automatically
Does not configure Vitest or test environment
Does not provide Playwright E2E test patterns
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Unit test services
use_cases.description: Create unit tests for new services and utilities using the standard describe-it-expect pattern.

use_cases.title: Test agent logic
use_cases.description: Write tests for AI agent processTask methods with mocked Supabase client.

use_cases.title: Validate API routes
use_cases.description: Test API endpoints including authentication, validation, and response handling.

prompt_templates.title: Create unit test
prompt_templates.scenario: Writing a unit test for a new service
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Vitest unit test for MyService that tests data processing and error handling. Use beforeEach for setup and vi.clearAllMocks.

prompt_templates.title: Test agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Vitest test for MyAgent.processTask with mocked Supabase. Include test task with workspace_id, task_type, and payload.

prompt_templates.title: API test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Vitest test for GET /api/my-endpoint that verifies workspace_id authentication is required. Expect 400 status on missing parameter.

prompt_templates.title: Mock Supabase
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to mock Supabase client in Vitest with mockFrom, mockSelect, mockEq functions that return test data.

output_examples.input: Write a Vitest test for UserService that tests user creation and validates input.
output: Test user creation with valid input
Test error handling for invalid input
Mock Supabase from() and insert() methods

output_examples.input: Create a test for an AI agent that processes tasks with a mocked database.
output: Define test task with required fields
Assert result is defined and valid

output_examples.input: Test an API endpoint that requires authentication.
output: Test with valid credentials for success case

best_practices: Use vi.clearAllMocks() in beforeEach to reset mock state between tests
Mock Supabase at the module level with vi.mock before describe blocks
Test authentication and validation first for API routes
Maintain 100% pass rate for all test suites
anti_patterns: Skipping test cleanup with beforeEach causing test pollution
Not mocking external dependencies like Supabase
Writing tests without assertions for error cases
Mixing integration and unit test patterns inappropriately

faq.question: What test framework does this skill use?
faq.answer: Vitest. Run tests with npm run test in the tests/ directory.

faq.question: What coverage targets are required?
faq.answer: 100% pass rate required for all tests. Coverage includes unit, integration, and E2E tests.

faq.question: How do I mock Supabase in tests?
faq.answer: Use vi.mock('@supabase/supabase-js') with createClient returning mocked from() with select/eq/insert.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running tests?
faq.answer: Yes. Tests use mocked dependencies and never connect to real databases or external services.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing with timeout errors?
faq.answer: Ensure async tests return promises. Check mock implementations use mockResolvedValue for async methods.

faq.question: How does this compare to Jest?
faq.answer: Vitest shares Jest API but is faster and integrates with Vite. Syntax and patterns are nearly identical.
